articles.author: Gerren Keith Gaynor
articles.title: United Airlines raising checked-bag fees beginning in March
articles.description: If you’re planning on flying United Airlines be prepared to pay a little more for your checked bag.
articles.content:
If you’re planning on flying United Airlines, be prepared to pay a little more for your checked bag.
The airline increased its checked-baggage fees on Friday by $5, following a similar move in January by JetBlue Airways, USA Today reports.

articles.title: Trump furious Americans infected with coronavirus flew back to US without his permission: report
articles.description: President Trump grew furious that 14 Americans infected with the coronavirus were allowed to fly back to the United States without his permission, rather than remaining quarantined overseas, according to a new report.
articles.content:
President Trump was furious that 14 Americans infected with the coronavirus returned to the United States without his permission rather than remain in quarantine overseas, according to a new report.

articles.author: Sally Pipes
articles.title: Sally Pipes: Mike Bloomberg has a lot of bad ideas for health care
articles.description: Bloomberg wants voters to believe he can bring moderation back to the White House. But his plan for health care features the same affinity for government overreach that has been his calling card throughout his political career.

articles.author: Gerren Keith Gaynor
articles.title: Where was the margarita invented?
articles.description: It’s sort of the grande dame of cocktails, particularly in America.
articles.content:
While there are hundreds, if not thousands, of cocktails known around the world, few are as popular as the margarita.
It’s sort of the grande dame of cocktails, particularly in America.

articles.title: What is frostbite and who is at risk?
articles.description: While some may believe the condition is temporary, it can actually lead to long-term or chronic health issues.

articles.title: Sen. Cotton on coronavirus: 'China is carefully managing the flow of information'
articles.description: Sen. Tom Cotton, R-Ark., appeared on "The Ingraham Angle" Friday and pushed back against accusations that he is floating conspiracy theories about the coronavirus and it's origins in China.
articles.content:
